maml:description.maml:para: Adds a member to a specific Role of a specific database.
The Add-RoleMember cmdlet adds a valid member to a specific Role of a specific database depending upon the input values.

maml:Description.maml:para: Database name to which the Role belongs to.
Name of the Role to which the member should be added.
The application Id for the service principal.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Name of the member who should be added to the role.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
The tenant Id for the service principal.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a member to the database role using the role's name

maml:description.maml:para: Enables a database administrator to take the backup of Analysis Service Database to a file.

Enables a database administrator to take the backup of Analysis Service Database to a file. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered. Database Administrator can also pass multiple databases through pipeline and perform the backup operation.

maml:Description.maml:para: The backup file path/name where database will be backed up. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered. This parameter will only be used if the database to backup is specified with the Name parameter, not if it is passed in with the Database parameter.
Analysis Services Database Name that has to be backed up.
Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during backup.
The application Id for the service principal.
Indicates whether the backup file will be compressed or not.
Indicates whether remote partitions will be backed up or not.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
The password to be used with backup file encryption
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
The tenant Id for the service principal.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Indicates whether the backup file will be compressed or not.
Indicates whether remote partitions will be backed up or not.
The Database or Databases to be backed up. The filename of the backup will be the same as the database.
The password to be used with backup file encryption

maml:description.maml:para: Enables a database administrator to execute an XMLA script, Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) query, or Data Mining Extensions (DMX) statement against an instance of Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services.

Enables a database administrator to execute an XMLA script, Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) query, or Data Mining Extensions (DMX) statement against an instance of Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services.
The cmdlets execution of these queries or scripts within input files.

The script that is passed is an XAML command and following commands are supported: Alter, Backup, Batch, BeginTransaction, Cancel, ClearCache, CommitTransaction, Create, Delete, DesignAggregations, Drop, Insert, Lock, MergePartitions, NotifyTableChange, Process, Restore, RollbackTransaction, Statement (used to execute MDX queries and DMX statements), Subscribe, Synchronize, Unlock, Update, UpdateCells.
This script will also accept JSON commands designed to execute against a tabular database with compatibility mode 1200 or higher.

maml:Description.maml:para: The application Id for the service principal.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.
@{Text=}

Specifies the number of seconds before the connection to the Analysis Services instance times out. The timeout value must be an integer between 0 and 65534. If 0 is specified, connection attempts do not time out.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

Specifies the database against which an MDX query or DMX statement will execute. The database parameter is ignored when the cmdlet executes an XMLA script, because the database name is embedded in the XMLA script.

Identifies the file that contains the XMLA script, MDX query, DMX statement, or TMSL script (in JSON). You must specify a value for either the �InputFile or the �Query parameter when using Invoke-AsCmd.
Specifies the number of seconds before the queries time out. If a timeout value is not specified, the queries do not time out. The timeout must be an integer between 1 and 65535.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
The tenant Id for the service principal.

Identifies a file that receives Analysis Services trace events while executing the XMLA script, MDX query, or DMX statement. If the file already exists, it is automatically overwritten (except for the trace files that are created by using the -TraceLevel:Duration and -TraceLevel:DurationResult parameter settings).
File names that contain spaces must be enclosed in quotation marks ("").
If the file name is not valid, an error message is generated.
Specifies a single character as the trace file delimiter when you specify csv as the format for the trace file that use the -TraceFileFormat parameter.
Default is | (pipe, or vertical bar).
Specifies the file format for the -TraceFile parameter (if this parameter is specified).
The default value is "Csv".
Specifies what data is collected and recorded in the trace file. Possible values are High, Medium, Low, Duration, DurationResult.
Specifies the number of seconds the Analysis Services engine waits before ending the trace (if you specify the -TraceFile parameter).
The trace is considered finished if no trace messages have been recorded during the specified time period.
The default trace time-out value is 5 seconds.

Specifies additional scripting variables. Each variable is a name- value pair. If the value contains embedded spaces or control characters, it must be enclosed in double-quotation marks. Use a PowerShell array to specify multiple variables and their values.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The application Id for the service principal.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.
@{Text=}

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

Specifies the database against which an MDX query or DMX statement will execute. The database parameter is ignored when the cmdlet executes an XMLA script, because the database name is embedded in the XMLA script.
Specifies the actual script, query, or statement directly on the command line instead of in a file.

maml:alert.maml:para: Supported on all Analysis Services instances

command:example.maml:title: ------------------------ Invoke select ------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-ASCmd -Database:"Adventure Works DW 2008R2" -Query:"SELECT {[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]} ON COLUMNS, BOTTOMCOUNT(NONEMPTY(DESCENDANTS( [Customer].[Customer Geography].[All Customers], [Customer].[Customer Geography].[Customer]), ( [Measures].[Internet Sales Amount] ) ), 10, ( [Measures].[Internet Sales Amount] )) ON ROWS FROM [Adventure Works] WHERE ( [Date].[Calendar].[Calendar Year].&[2008] )"

command:example.maml:title: ----------------------- Invoke select 2 -----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-ASCmd -Database:"Adventure Works DW 2008R2" -Query:"SELECT MODEL_CATALOG, MODEL_NAME, ATTRIBUTE_NAME, NODE_NAME FROM [Forecasting].CONTENT"

maml:description.maml:para: Conducts the Process operation on a specified Database with a specific ProcessType or RefreshType depending on the underlying metadata type.
Conducts the Process operation on a specified Database with a specific ProcessType or RefreshType depending on the underlying metadata type.

Use ProcessType for database with multidimensional metadata (this includes tabular databases with compatibility level less than 1200). Use RefreshType for tabular databases with compatibility level 1200 or higher.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the process type for a Tabular database.

See Process Database, Table, or Partition (Analysis Services) (https://docs.microsoft.com/sql/analysis-services/tabular-models/process-database-table-or-partition-analysis-services)for descriptions and guidance.
The application Id for the service principal.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.
If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance.
If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Specifies the Tabular or Multidimensional database to be processed.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
The tenant Id for the service principal.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the process type for a Multidimensional database or a Tabular database at compatibility levels 1050-1103.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command pipes in the identity of the partition to be processed.

command:example.maml:title: ----------------- Process partition using name -----------------
command:example.dev:code: PS SQL SERVER:\SQLAS\MachineName\Instance\Databases\AWTEST\Cubes\Adventure Works\MeasureGroups> Invoke-ProcessPartition �Name "Total_Orders_2003" �MeasureGroupname "Sales Order" �CubeName "Adventure Works" �database "AWTEST" �ProcessType "ProcessFull"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command processes the partition 'Total_Orders_2003' in the 'Sales Orders' measure group of the 'AWTEST' database.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet merges the data of one or more source partitions into a target partition and deletes the source partitions.
This cmdlet merges the data of one or more source partitions into a target partition and deletes the source partitions.
Partitions can be merged only if they meet all the following criteria: - Partitions are in the same measure group.
- Partitions are stored in the same mode (MOLAP, HOLAP, and ROLAP).

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the target partition to where the source partitions data will be merged.
The application Id for the service principal.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Name of the cube under which the partitions exist.
Name of the Analysis Server database where the partitions exist.
Name of the Measure Group under which the partitions exist.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
Source partition names from which data is merged to target partition.
The tenant Id for the service principal.

maml:description.maml:para: Used to add a restore location to the server.

The New-RestoreLocation cmdlet contains information used to restore a database, including the connection string of the server and database, data source properties, files and folders associated with the database that is being restored.

maml:Description.maml:para: The application Id for the service principal.
Specifies whether the object should be created in memory and returned.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.
Specifies the connection string of a remote Analysis Services instance.

This parameter is used to pass in a username and password when using an HTTP connection to an Analysis Service instance, for an instance that you have configured for HTTP access. For more information, see Configure HTTP Access to Analysis Services on Internet Information Services (IIS) 8.0 (https://docs.microsoft.com/sql/analysis-services/instances/configure-http-access-to-analysis-services-on-iis-8-0)for HTTP connections.

If this parameter is specified, the username and password will be used to connect to the specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified, default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
To use this parameter, first create a PSCredential object using Get-Credential to specify the username and password (for example,
$Cred = Get-Credential "adventure-works\bobh"
. You can then pipe this object to the �Credential parameter (
-Credential $Cred
@{Text=}
Specifies whether the data source is remote or local, based on the location of the partition.
Specifies the name of the backup file that you are restoring.
Specifies partition folders on the local or remote instance.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
The tenant Id for the service principal.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores a specified Analysis Service database from a backup file.

Enables a database administrator to restore the Analysis Service Database from a backup file. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered.

maml:Description.maml:para: Restores a specified Analysis Service database from a backup file.
Analysis Services Database Name that has to be restored.
Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during restore.
The application Id for the service principal.
The certificate thumbprint for the service principal.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Remote location of the partitions to be restored.
The password to use to decrypt the restoration file.
Represents security settings for the restore operation.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.
Specifies that this connection is using service principal.
The database storage location.
